title: Establishment of International AI Governance Standard
description: This principle underscores the creation of the first intergovernmental standard for AI, providing a unified framework to guide countries in AI governance. It ensures consistency, cooperation, and a coordinated approach to addressing AI challenges and opportunities globally.
key_requirements: Official status as an OECD Legal Instrument
Free access with non-alteration reproduction rights
representative_text: The Recommendation on Artificial Intelligence (AI) (hereafter the 'Recommendation') – the first intergovernmental standard on AI – was adopted by the OECD Council meeting at Ministerial level...

title: Responsible Stewardship of Trustworthy AI
description: This principle establishes that AI systems should be developed and used in ways that prioritize ethical considerations, safety, and accountability. It emphasizes the need for all stakeholders to adhere to complementary principles that ensure AI benefits society as a whole while respecting human rights and democratic values. The principle is foundational as it sets the ethical and operational guidelines for AI governance, ensuring trustworthiness and long-term viability in a rapidly evolving field.
key_requirements: Promote inclusive growth, sustainable development, and well-being
Respect the rule of law, human rights, and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
Ensure transparency and explainability in AI systems
Maintain robustness, security, and safety of AI systems
Establish accountability among AI actors according to their roles
representative_text: Principles for responsible stewardship of trustworthy AI: the first section sets out five complementary principles relevant to all stakeholders.

title: Responsible AI Governance
description: This principle emphasizes the need for comprehensive and ethical management of AI systems, ensuring transparency, safety, accountability, and environmental sustainability. It encompasses measures to prevent misuse, promote cooperation among stakeholders, and maintain integrity in AI operations.
key_requirements: Provide clear information to users about AI systems
Prevent and address intentional or unintentional misuse
Ensure safety measures to override or decommission harmful AI
Promote cooperation among jurisdictions and stakeholders
Consider environmental sustainability in AI development and use
representative_text: clarifying the information AI actors should provide regarding AI systems to ensure transparency and responsible disclosure

title: Responsible Stewardship of Trustworthy AI
description: This principle emphasizes the importance of managing AI systems in a manner that prioritizes societal well-being, environmental sustainability, and adherence to ethical and legal standards. It ensures that AI technologies are developed and deployed responsibly to maximize benefits and minimize harm.
key_requirements: Promote inclusive growth and sustainable development
Respect the rule of law, human rights, and democratic values
Ensure fairness and privacy in AI systems
representative_text: Stakeholders should proactively engage in responsible stewardship of trustworthy AI in pursuit of beneficial outcomes for people and the planet.
